data.title: couldn't find "libcocos2djs.so"
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:cocos crator 1.4.2
- devices test on:android 
- developing environments
   - NDK version: android-ndk-r14b-darwin-x86_64
   - Xcode version: xcode8.3.2
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a new hello_world projects
2. build->choose android->use default template ->build
3.use android studio2.3 import the proj.android-studio, after compile i click run button ,

The android device show me:"unfortunately ,hello_world has stoped".

   - VS version: 2015

1. use android studio 2.3.2 open cpp-empty-test\proj.android-studio

External Native Build Issues
Build command failed.
Error while executing process C:\Android\android-sdk\ndk-bundle\ndk-build.cmd with arguments {NDK_PROJECT_PATH=null APP_BUILD_SCRIPT=D:\cocos2d-x-3.15.1\tests\cpp-empty-test\proj.android-studio\app\jni\Android.mk NDK_APPLICATION_MK=D:\cocos2d-x-3.15.1\tests\cpp-empty-test\proj.android-studio\app\jni\Application.mk APP_ABI=armeabi NDK_ALL_ABIS=armeabi NDK_DEBUG=0 APP_PLATFORM=android-9 NDK_OUT=D:/cocos2d-x-3.15.1/tests/cpp-empty-test/proj.android-studio/app/build/intermediates/ndkBuild/release/obj NDK_LIBS_OUT=D:\cocos2d-x-3.15.1\tests\cpp-empty-test\proj.android-studio\app\build\intermediates\ndkBuild\release\lib NDK_TOOLCHAIN_VERSION=4.9 APP_PLATFORM=android-13 NDK_MODULE_PATH=D:/cocos2d-x-3.15.1;D:/cocos2d-x-3.15.1/cocos;D:/cocos2d-x-3.15.1/external -j4 NDK_DEBUG=0 APP_SHORT_COMMANDS=false LOCAL_SHORT_COMMANDS=false -B -n}

data.title: DrawNode sometimes not visible in Android API 16 and may crash
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: Cocos2d-x 3.15
- devices test on: Andromax JSR U - Android API 16
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13b
   - Xcode version:-
   - VS version:-
   - browser type and version:-

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create DrawNode on init then make draw segment on touchBegan/Moved
2. Clear onTouchEnd
3. Retry if not crashed yet, it will have 2 options: draw is shown but crash, or draw is not shown.

for now i just add API protection so it will not using drawNode in API 16 or lower.

data.title: Segmentation fault with nil arg
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use `nil` as arg to `:addComponent`
2. Get crash with `Segmentation fault (core dumped)`

I accidentally ran

```
    self:addComponent(phbody);
```
without `phbody`.

Building mode: debug

invalid literal for float(): 8.3.2

data.title: CocosStudio .csb reading bug.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: win32
- developing environments
   - VS version: 2013

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  In cocos empty test add content of archive https://www.dropbox.com/s/zut1fdlsvbxid39/cocos_studio_outline_crash.zip?dl=0
 into Resources folder (there is scene with label with enabled outline).
2.  In cocos empty test add 
`const flatbuffers::CSParseBinary * content_binary = nullptr;`
`cocos2d::Data data = FileUtils::getInstance()->getDataFromFile( "Scene.csb" );`
`const flatbuffers::CSParseBinary * flat_buffer = flatbuffers::GetCSParseBinary( data.getBytes() );`
`cocos2d::Node* scene = CSLoader::getInstance()->nodeWithFlatBuffers(flat_buffer->nodeTree());`
`this->addChild( scene );`
into 
`HelloWorld::init()`

Add some includes : 
`#include "cocostudio/FlatBuffersSerialize.h"`
`#include "cocostudio/CSParseBinary_generated.h"`
`#include "cocostudio/ActionTimeline/CSLoader.h"`
3. Comment `#include "ExtensionMacros.h"` in FlatBufferSerialize.h
4. compile and run

Will crash at reading .csb file.
Caused by updating flatbuffer to 1.5 version with generating new headers by existing fbs files.

I understand that you closed support of CocosStudio without promise of backward capability, but I don't understand why you need to update flatbuffer. It's used in CocosStudio reader only ( There is no other usages, I'v checked ). If you don't want to support it anymore - remove it. If you still support it keep it working.

data.title: Problems with labels loaded from csb file
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15

Reproduce:
Load scene made in Cocos Studio.

If using custom size, all the labels are aligned on the center.
If using auto size, all the labels are aligned on the left.
Vertical alignment seems to not work at all.
Sometimes labels does not show at all. 

More info here:
http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/cocostudio-bug-in-cocos2d-x-3-15/36591/9

It works fine in cocos2d-x 3.14.1.

Solution:
use old cocosstudio directory from 3.14.1.

Please fix this :) It does not require changing anything in Cocos Studio itself.

data.title: Possible bug introduced in AudioEngine or intended behavior?
data.body:
I just updated cocos2d-x to the current version in the repo and I've been getting a crash on my sound playback callback.

Because of a change in `AudioEngineImpl::update(float dt) `the finish callback is now called after `AudioEngine::remove()`.
You can see this change in this commit: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/6217d8c

My crash occurs because I'm calling `AudioEngine::getProfile(audioID)` (using the provided id in the callback) in my finish callback but since `AudioEngine::remove()` is being called before the audio has already been erased from `_audioIDInfoMap`.

I've already fixed the crash on my side but I'm wondering if this is intended behavior. It doesn't make sense to receive the audioID in the callback if you can't use it to query AudioEngine since the audio was already removed.

data.title: Memory leaks caused by static field in Cocos2dx related class
data.body:
I have an Android App which embed Cocos Activity, like most Activities in my App is normal Android Activity except a few of Cocos Activities which inherited from Cocos2dxActivity.

When I quit from Cocos Activity and back to normal Activity,the static field(e.g. sContext) in Cocos2dxActivity can cause memory leaks.

So how I can do to fix this kind of issue?

data.title: [cocos2d-x 3.15] ui::ScrollView has an abnormal clipping bug and a  layer order problem.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: simulator
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 
   - Xcode version: 8.2.1
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open cocos2d_tests.xcodeproj 
2. Select cpp-tests iOS build target
3. Open UIScrollViewTests.cpp
4. Add following code at line 77 so that the test sprite can be a child of first button of scroll view.
> auto test = Sprite::create("Images/arrows-hd.png");
> test->setPosition(button->getContentSize() * 0.5);
> button->addChild(test);

Problems:
1. The test sprite(child) is hidden by button sprite(parent).
2.  If I scroll up and down, the button sprite(parent) is cut off outside the clipping area, but the test sprite(child) appears.

Please check the topic I created at the forum:
[http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/strange-phenomenon-at-ui-scrollview-in-cocos2d-x-3-15/37044](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/strange-phenomenon-at-ui-scrollview-in-cocos2d-x-3-15/37044)

Incorrect spacing between characters when using .ttf font
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15+
- devices test on: iOS, mac, android

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use font http://www.1001fonts.com/good-times-font.html  
2. For my game specially this part of the text is different: "OW": 

Target: 

![target](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3391456/26325501/cfe1272e-3f3f-11e7-9cac-61a4826bd0e2.png)

Actual result(notice it's wider and more space between): 

![result](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3391456/26325508/d69f7f02-3f3f-11e7-9a6c-f3325bcd4e38.png)

Target comes from cocos2d-iphone v3, I'm porting my game and notice this difference.  So, in old ObjC version all fine, no gap. 
But in cocos2d-x using same .ttf file makes my text drawn in different way.  I believe this is a bug. Text should be with less spacing between letters.

data.title: camera movement on a layer that is added as a child of scrollview
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: 6S+

I want to create a similar movement that is available in cpp test NewRendererTest BugAutoCulling::BugAutoCulling() but in vertical direction. But I am not able to create it. See the attached file for full code and resources. 

So the layer on which I am trying to move the camera is added as a child to the scrollview and I want that when the camera move user should see the effect of moving layer but actually camera is moving like that in  cpp test NewRendererTest BugAutoCulling::BugAutoCulling() .

for full code please see the attached files as well.

see here as well
http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/camera-movement-on-layer-that-is-a-child-of-scroll-view/36996

[Classes.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/1019300/Classes.zip)

data.title: Memory leak at spine jsb.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: Mac-Mini, IPhone 6S
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r14b
   - Xcode version: 8.1
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run js test project included in sdk packet
2. Press Spine Test and then press Main Menu
3. press Sys Tests and find restartGame and press it
4. press Spine Test
5. memory will increase about 300kb per second until system crash.
In my working project I have the same problem. How to check where the problem, or you know solution?
